title: A compliment on what Riot really managed to balance
body:
Their matchmaking to generate autolosses. Seriously.
It's probably the most consistent aspect of this game at this point. 

**People wouldn't be so toxic if winning/improving wasn't actively punished.**

Oh, you've won 7 games on your way back to plat? F****** Challenger smurf, here's 4 tilted players on a losing streak and a Gold IV Veigar that just happened to take your main role. Carry this. 

Fkin send me to the Shadow Realm already

It's hard to see the addiction aspect of it but it's true. It's not so much "Wow, I just lost 4 times this is so fun!" it's "Damnit all I lost again, just one more, I know I'll win this time!" That or people refusing to leave on a losing streak (or for that matter a winning streak).

What everyone commonly refers to as getting tilted is actually a symptom of addiction, sort of "winning withdrawal" where it becomes a lot harder to put the game aside even though it's actually hurting your climb rather than helping, all because you get it in your head that you can get past it in the moment if you just play another round.

EDIT: The thing about using this model to create an addictive gaming pattern is that if the negatives outweigh the positives too consistently or too severely, it can actually have the reverse effect and snap someone out of building an addiction to a game, leaving them disillusioned with the experience.

Promos really need to go. Making some games arbitrarily more important than others makes getting feeders in those games so much worse.

I totally agree that win and loss streaks should not be taken into account for matchmaking.  Notice I said MATCHMAKING not ELO or MMR.

Here's the deal.  It's a good system when your matchmaking value goes up faster than your visible rank or elo.  Example: It's OK for a Gold 5 player to go on a 10 game win streak to get into G4 and then all of the sudden start running into G1 and Platinum 5 players.  You will either start getting smacked and things will level out, or you will rightfully keep winning and just get where you belong faster.  This part RIOT does correctly.

Here's what doesn't work, putting players on a losing streak on the team with someone on a win streak.  Now I understand the idea here.  You want to make sure the winning player isn't just by luck getting carried repeatedly and that the losing players aren't just having bad luck and getting sandbagged by trolls repeatedly.  I get that.  I really do.  But the game is not balanced for that.  

When you put a player on an upswing on a team with 3 players who are either significantly lower elo and/or on a losing streak, you are essentially saying that if you are so good you should be able to carry 3-4 other tilted players.  RIOT themselves has said they don't want League to be a game where a person can reliably solo carry.  So you create a system where a person has to do something you don't want them to be able to do in order to win?  It's directly contradictory.  Champions and roles are not designed/balanced to solo carry, so do not implement a mechanic that creates and artificial environment that most likely (by design) results in a loss.

My only explanation for this is the almighty $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$.  If I had to guess I'd say this mechanic exists so that if a historically silver player gets a stroke of luck and goes on a win streak he finds himself in Gold territory and decides to stop playing so that he can maintain the end season rewards.  Or conversely, that if a traditionally higher elo player randomly gets sandbagged he doesn't decide to stop playing because he's had to play 20 games in  top gold when he's never had an issue making it to Platinum in the past.

Human interference ruing a system that would be so much better when random.  Let win streaks boost hidden MMR and to some degree actual visible ELO, but do not let them become a factor in matching based on win lose streaks.  Just let matchmaking be fully based on MMR/ELO.  If we lose a player just because they found themselves a little higher or lower, they were gonna quit soon anyway the minute their favorite champ or style of play got nerfed.

Here are my questions to RIOT:

Do the above situations really happen often enough that you are OK irritating the crap out of people trying to hard climb? (I'm guessing the number of people trying to climb and getting snubbed by this mechanic is much much higher than the number of people who might actually quit or reduce their game volume in a significant way).

Do you actually think that going on a losing streak because of just random bad luck is more annoying than a system in your favorite game actively trying to stop your win streak despite it being contradictory to the game's philosophy?

P.S. If you actually take my advice and you find a player who has been silver or lower for 3 seasons or more on their main account suddenly get carried by luck into Diamond, I will retract all previous statements, acknowledge that RIOTers are amazing God-Prophets and will purchase a skin for every champion in the game.
